verb.description: Make (something) appear larger than it is, especially with a lens or microscope.
examples: the camera's zoom mode can magnify a certain area if required
praise the Lord and magnify Him

origin: Late Middle English (in the senses show honor to (God) and make greater): from Old French magnifier or Latin magnificare, based on Latin magnus great. magnify (sense 1) dates from the mid 17th century.
